Download GTFS feed from MobilityData hosted URL

Source: R/integration-tidytransit.R
mobdb_download_feed.Rd

Downloads the latest GTFS feed using MobilityData's hosted/archived URL rather than the provider's source URL. This ensures you're getting the exact version stored in MobilityData's database with validated metadata.

Usage

mobdb_download_feed(feed_id, latest = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

feed_id

Character. The unique identifier for the feed (e.g., "mdb-2862").

latest

Logical. If TRUE (default), download the most recent dataset. If FALSE, returns information about all available datasets.

...

Additional arguments passed to tidytransit::read_gtfs().

Value

If latest = TRUE, a gtfs object as returned by tidytransit::read_gtfs(). If latest = FALSE, a tibble of all available datasets with their metadata.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Download latest MobilityData-hosted version
gtfs <- mobdb_download_feed("mdb-2862")

# See all available versions
versions <- mobdb_download_feed("mdb-2862", latest = FALSE)
} # }
